skos:ConceptScheme.dc:description: This vocabulary is used in the PITHIA_Computation object to describe its type, e.g. mathematical model, software (like ARTIST, etc).

skos:Concept.skos:definition: A computed value that is interpreted as a level (metric) of activity within the feature of interest. While based on underlying acquisitions (measurements) and computations (models) of real physical quantities, an activity indicator may or may not directly correspond to an observed property with explicit definitions of its phenomenon, measurand, and units of the value presentation.
Activity indicator pertaining to events on the Sun.
Activity indicator pertaining to events on the Sun.
The sunspot number SN (written with subscript N) is given as the daily total sunspot number version 2.0 introduced in 2015 and provided by WDC-SILSO, Royal Observatory of Belgium, Brussels.
McIntosh-Hale classification of the active regions on the Sun.
Local noon-time 10.7 cm solar radio flux provided by Dominion Radio Astrophysical Observatory and Natural Resources Canada.
Local noon-time 10.7 cm solar radio flux as observed and provided by Dominion Radio Astrophysical Observatory and Natural Resources Canada.
Local noon-time 10.7 cm solar radio flux, observed, adjusted, and provided by Dominion Radio Astrophysical Observatory and Natural Resources Canada.
Activity indicator pertaining to events in the Magnetosphere of the Earth.
Activity indicator pertaining to events in the Earth's Ionosphere.

Scintillation index derived from amplitude variations of GNSS signal. It is defined as the normalized standard deviation of the detrended 50 Hz raw signal intensity over a given interval of time, typically 60 s.

Scintillation index derived from phase fluctuations of the GNSS signal. It is defined as the standard deviation of the 50 Hz detrended carrier phase over a given interval of time, typically 60 s and is given in radians.
Rate Of change of TEC (ROT) is the time derivative of the slant Total Electron Content (sTEC) values evaluated between two epochs.
Rate Of TEC Index (ROTI) is defined as the standard deviation of the Rate of change of TEC (ROT) evaluated for every radio link over a time-interval typically of 1 to 5 minutes.
Activity indicator pertaining to disturbances in the geomagnetic field.
Activity indicator pertaining to mean global disturbances in the geomagnetic field.
Three-hourly sub-auroral geomagnetic activity indicator provided by GFZ Potsdam, Germany.
Thirty-minute sub-auroral geomagnetic activity indicator.
Sixty-minute (hourly) sub-auroral geomagnetic activity indicator.
Linear representation of the quasi-logarithmic Kp index.

skos:Concept.skos:prefLabel: Ap Index, Daily Mean of ap Indices
skos:Concept.skos:definition: Daily mean of ap sub-auroral geomagnetic activity indicators.
Linear representation of the quasi-logarithmic Kp30 index.
Linear representation of the quasi-logarithmic Kp60 index.

The Dst or disturbance storm time index is a measure of geomagnetic activity used to assess the severity of magnetic storms. It is expressed in nanoteslas (nT) and is based on the average value of the horizontal component of the Earth's magnetic field measured hourly at four near-equatorial geomagnetic observatories. Use of the Dst as an index of storm strength is possible because the strength of the surface magnetic field at low latitudes is inversely proportional to the energy content of the ring current, which increases during geomagnetic storms. In the case of a classic magnetic storm, the Dst shows a sudden rise, corresponding to the storm sudden commencement, and then decreases sharply as the ring current intensifies. Once the IMF turns northward again and the ring current begins to recover, the Dst begins a slow rise back to its quiet time level. The relationship of inverse proportionality between the horizontal component of the magnetic field and the energy content of the ring current is known as the Dessler-Parker-Sckopke relation. Other currents contribute to the Dst as well, most importantly the magnetopause current. The Dst index is corrected to remove the contribution of this current as well as that of the quiet-time ring current.

DSO (Magnetopause Stand-off Distance) index describes location of the magnetopause, the boundary between the magnetic field of the planet and the solar wind. The location of the magnetopause is determined by the balance between the pressure of the planetary magnetic field and the dynamic pressure of the solar wind and is given as the DSO index.
Activity indicator pertaining to locally observed disturbances in the geomagnetic field.
Three-hourly geomagnetic disturbance indicator provided by individual stations.
Three-hourly linear representation geomagnetic disturbance indicator provided by individual stations.
Polar cap indices of geomagnetic disturbances due to transpolar convection of plasma that are representative of the energy input from the solar wind.
Northern Polar Cap index of geomagnetic disturbances from Qaanaaq observatory.
Southern Polar Cap index of geomagnetic disturbances from Vostok observatory.
Model based on theoretical treatment of the system, goverened by underlying physical processes expressed as equations. Also known as First-Principles model.
A family of models that employ numerical computations to describe physical systems, usually based on approximations rather than direct theoretical solutions or reasoning
Computer techniques to reason about physical systems based on prediction of their behavioral scenarios from an approximate system description
Model computation based on purely mathematical considerations. Compare to theoretical model based on first-principle physics approach.

skos:Concept.skos:prefLabel: Fitting a parametric model to given data
skos:Concept.skos:definition: Family of techniques that find the best-fit parameters of a model function to given data

skos:Concept.skos:prefLabel: Computations based on the geometric treatment of the problem
Computations based on the tomographic considerations
Line Integral along a path in 1D
skos:Concept.skos:definition: An integral of a descrete function (i.e., sum of the function values) along a 1D path
Conversion of slant to vertical TEC
Model based on analyses of available observational data
Estimation of the physical system behavior based on its statistical sample
A subclass of statistical models that represents an observed empirical observation of the system behavior
A subclass of statistical models that assesses probabilities of the system behavioral scenarios
Estimation of the physical system behavior based on AI-based learning of the system's essence from previous observations
Machine learning models based on the neuron doctrine to mimic complex system behavior using collective interaction of interconnected elemental multiple-input-single-output units
Machine learning models based on neural networks of particular multi-level hierarchy to detect and represent system's essence with an increasing top-down learned detail of its abstraction
A hierarchical tree-like model that represents different possible scenarios of the system behavior as determined by its the control parameters
A modelling principle that establishes linear dependences of the dependent output variables on the independent input variables
A family of algorithms that detect groupings in the set of objects by their similarity
Models that combine various types of modelling approaches
Model that can transform the underlying theoretical, numerical, or data-driven for a better match with observational data, often in real-time
Semi-empirical models apply the data-driven modelling principle within its internal physics-informed (theortical) organization
Computation steps applied to measurement data in order to select, condition (improve quality), or derive new observed properties
Interpretation of the signal signatures in ionogram images to extract secondary (actionable) information about properties of the ionosphere
Automatic recognition of ionogram signatures to extract secondary (actionable) information about the ionosphere
Manual interpretation of ionogram images, usually performed as correction/editing of the autoscaling results
Scaling plasmagram image to derived secondary products such as traces, resonance frequencies, profiles of electron density
Scaling plasmagrams using an interactive manual editor software
Scaling plasmagrams using an intelligent system software
Scaling of spectrogram image to obtained secondary data products such as electron plasma and electron gyro-frequency
Scaling of spectrograms using manual image editing software
Scaling of spectrograms using an intelligent system software
A variety of computational techniques that select/subset and improve quality of measurement data.
A class of signal processing techniques specific to GNSS (both ground and spaceborn reception)
Conversion of the count units as sampled by the instrument to physical units
A variety of statistical computations to reason about the measurement properties, such as averaging and variance evaluation.
